website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for kitten milk replacement for newborn orphans, this is the next best thing to mother's milk. It's also worth considering for senior cats in declining health.
pros: Formulated with quality protein and vitamins that are beneficial to newborns
Contains probiotics, and is gentle on the stomach
Flavor is appealing for adult cats that could benefit from the nutrient-rich formula as a supplement or food replacement
cons: Rich formula has been known to cause diarrhea until kittens/cats adjust to it
Undissolved chunks often remain when you mix it with water

customer_reviews.title: Difference between PetLac and KMR
customer_reviews.text: There is a difference between this, PetLac, and the KMR formula. I started a two day old abandoned kitten on this and switched about a week later to the KMR formula made by the same company. The kitten had trouble digesting the KMR and got diarrhea. There is no way I can know 100% if it was because of the switch in formula, but it wasn't worth continuing to chance it so I quickly switched back. Over the past two weeks the kitten has been good. There is a difference in ingredients and fat to protein ratios. Petlac was also a few dollars cheaper at the time of purchases.
customer_reviews.author: JuAn

customer_reviews.title: For senior cats too
customer_reviews.text: Used for my senior cat when he was losing weight and had no appetite. This and another brand saved his life. He ate it readily and seemed to reallly enjoy it. I know they make senior formulas but I feel the kitten milk has more fat and calories.
customer_reviews.author: pattysue

customer_reviews.title: Saved my elderly cat's quality of life when kidney failure ...
customer_reviews.text: Saved my elderly cat's quality of life when kidney failure started, he only started suffering the last 3 weeks of his life before we admitted defeat and took him to the vet; but petlac gave him about a year of fattening up. :) Since, I've also used this formula for infant abandoned kittens and it saved their little lives, too.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea P

customer_reviews.title: Shocked to find the can only half full.
customer_reviews.text: It sells as 10 oz but contains about 1.5 millimeters higher powder than the 6 oz can of the competeing brand’s formula. Seems like a cheat. It clumps less and produces a more viscous milk so maybe it is heavier but then why not a smaller can? The viscous milk is not great if you are mixing it with wet food but might be a plus if you are bottle feeding. Also my foster kittens shunned it. So i will likely not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Can Partially Full???
customer_reviews.text: Got this today, opened sealed can and it is only 3/4 of the way full that is ridiculous!!
customer_reviews.author: DavesAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great formula for itty bitty little kittens
customer_reviews.text: I have raised a lot of baby kittens, and this is my favorite formula to use. Some of the other formulas like the GNC brand smell really chemical-ish. Then there is the Hartz brand that is like liquid, milky poison. This brand however, is fabulous, and makes for nice, healthy, fat kittens. I use just the formula for the first few weeks, then as they get older i mix it with a little baby food chicken (beechnut) and a little bit of baby food rice cereal. I ween then using the same formula, just increasing the chicken and rice, then we move on to canned kitten food.
customer_reviews.author: Piper

customer_reviews.title: Mixes Well but Kittens Hated It
customer_reviews.text: It mixed up beautifully with very little clumping. I work with neo-natal kittens & had used a different brand previously that they guzzled down. Unfortunately the kittens hated this mix, fought feeding and threw up and had diarrhea. When I put down a cup of it for a bit older kitten, he tried to “bury” it. Not sure if it’s flavor, too rich even when extra water added or what but I had to switch back to the other.
customer_reviews.author: beckstar

customer_reviews.title: Diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I had a litter up and die due to diarrhea. They did not have coccidia, guardia, or panleuk because I took them to the vet a couple of times, but they wasted away and then died horribly while I was holding them. I don't know if it's from this milk replacement or some mystery illness, but I have stopped using it and am warning everyone to stay away from this. Not sure what I'll do with what I have left. Maybe give it to the dog?
customer_reviews.author: Flyswatter

customer_reviews.title: Best kitten formula for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was nursing a 4 week old rescued kitten and she loved this. Buying the powder formula is so much smarter because it doesn't have to be refrigerated. It comes with a tablespoon scoop so it's easy to put one 1 spoon of formula and 2 spoons of hot water so that it's warm like mother's milk. I reordered this several times and was easy to get this skinny kitten healthy. It's more economical than the price at the big box store and is delivered to my porch. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby A. Pender

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product 100% recommended
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on the can coming in half empty. However mine was more than halfway full do I’m happy with it. My 7 year old cat has a kitten complex so she kneads excessively. I decided to buy her milk and a bottle , to my surprise she loved the milk and went crazy with the smell. To mix it I found yo be very easy, I microwaved 2 teaspoons of water for 20 seconds on a cup, mixed in one teaspoon of the powder until no clumps, tossed it into the bottle and fed my cat. Remaining milk I stored in the refrigerator. My little cat is very happy and I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Foxpoison

customer_reviews.title: It came half empty
customer_reviews.text: I rescued some kittens and needed to help them survive. I ordered this milk and it came half empty. I asked if this was normal since I have never had to purchase powder milk before. I was told it was fine because they go by weight. This sounded shady to me but it became very clear that this was so untrue when I bought a can from a different brand that to my surprised when I opened it was full, same size as the first I bought. I will never buy anything from this brand. Plus it gave my kittens diarrhea. Awful experience.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene K. Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Great for supplemental feeding of older kittens.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Petlac as a supplement for my kitten. He was emaciated (weighed only 8.5 oz) when my husband picked him up off the side of the road two weeks ago, and was in major need of nutritional help. I bought a can of Petlac and some kitten food at Petsmart, and the kitten improved dramatically. This is his second can of Petlac. One thing to note is that the fat content for Petlac is significantly lower than KMR. If you’re bottle feeding tiny babies, you’re better off feeding KMR. But for supplemental feeding of weaned kittens, Petlac is cheaper and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not as good as other brands
customer_reviews.text: This worked ok, but its not as good as other brands I've used. A bit harder to mix, and I have difficulty getting all the lumps out, even with the gradual addition of water that usually works for easier and smoother blending. Also my rescue kittens seemed not to like the taste as well - this was the third brand of kitten milk replacer I used with this litter and they definitely prefered the other two. That being said, they did eat it and grow but I'll buy other brands when possible.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great when fostering kittens with no mama
customer_reviews.text: Every year we tend to foster mamaless kittens or a mama with too many kittens to care for on her own. I started using this because it is great for kittens. it has all the nutrients they need to grow. It can be made in small or large batches depending on kitten amount and how much is needed to feed. Formula dissolves easily and mixes well so there is no issues with clogging bottles. You can even use it to soften dry food to get them used to eating regular kitten food.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiFar83

customer_reviews.title: Remember to refrigerate after opening
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a great product, all four kittens loved the stuff and are now off the kmr. We got them at two to three weeks old and bottle fed them and have had great results, they are all now weaned and fat happy kittens. But remember REFRIGERATE AFTER OPENING.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan M.

customer_reviews.title: Cleft Palate Cat Loves It
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for the past couple years for my cat who was born with a cleft palate. He didn't have surgery and can't eat with his head down so we bottle or spoon feed him every day. I mix this milk with baby cereal (for consistency) and jars of turkey baby food, the milk helps ensure he has a balanced diet while the turkey adds more taste and nutrition. He's 10 this year and one of the healthiest cats bodywise I've ever met. He's all lean thick muscle and agile ability even if he's only 5lbs and looks like a kitten still. Definitely my go-to milk replacer.
customer_reviews.author: Lefitte

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect for my foster kittens!
customer_reviews.text: This powder is gentle on little tummies. I've used KMR and a GNC brand and along with being very expensive, they always gave my foster babies diarrhea. I originally started buying this from Wal-Mart but for convenience I started buying on Amazon. The powder also mixes very well. I'll use a small container with a blender ball from a shake cup and it works like a charm. Don't waste your $$ on other brands! This is all you need
customer_reviews.author: Brenda B.

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for mom
customer_reviews.text: I used this and the liquid but not at the same time I gradually changed as the liquid premix is much more expensive. I liked the ease of the premix. but the mix and you go could be mixed at the correct temperature. ONE important thing is to use either filter water or bottled. When I used water from my sink everyone got diarrhea. Now it could have been something else but chances are it was the water.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy F

customer_reviews.title: I noticed after the first week that he didn't seem to like it very much and would try to bury it ...
customer_reviews.text: The kitten I adopted was just 8 weeks old. Old enough to be weaned, but abandoned by the side of my road. He was way undernourished so I tried to use this on him. I noticed after the first week that he didn't seem to like it very much and would try to bury it like he does his poo in the litter box. LOL So after trying for one last time I decided that he preferred wet and dry cat foods so I stopped using it. But I believe that had he been younger than 8 weeks (the vet guessed 8-9 weeks) that this would have been perfectly fine for him, so I'm rating it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is so much cheaper here than it is getting it in a store in a store there’s like $23 so ridiculous I’m happy with how fast I got it it was next day shipping and my kittens that I have adopted and the ones I fostered have grown so much on this. Happy kittens mean good formula your stool is not runny whatsoever and it’s easy to mix in to wet food and then bring them up to speed with regular cat food
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it, especially if on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I ended up with 2 litters of abandoned kittens this year. This was the cheapest formula I could find and with 4 kittens eating around the clock, cheap was important. They all grew well and did really well on it. My only issue was that it seemed to separate if it was not shaken frequently once mixed. The kittens did seems to have some constipation on this, so I did mix a little electrolytes with it once a day.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney A

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice!
customer_reviews.text: Ran out of KMR do go PetAg PetLac and it made my 3 newborn kitties sick. Major diarrhea. Switched to goats milk and two got better immediately but the third (the runt) is still having major GI issues from the toxic effects from this formula. I’ve heard many others say this particular formula is not good but thought it wasn’t true. Now I’m a believer. I’ll stick with the KMR one or goats milk.
customer_reviews.author: Stefani

customer_reviews.title: Rescue kitten loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I rescued a kitten that was birthed in my garage. The mother did not return and his 4 siblings had passed away. I had used this formula for my kitten since day 2 of his birth. I don't believe he had any colostrum from his mother. I was not able to get a surrogate mother for him at the shelter either, due to high volume kitten season and his very low birth weight. I nursed my little guy to health and he is very strong and super gentle. This whole experience has been very rewarding. He is now 6 weeks old and running around playing with his toys. I appreciate Amazon for selling this formula at the price given.
customer_reviews.author: N Mc

customer_reviews.title: PetLac for kittens is Totally Awesome 😊😍
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kitten Formula we rescued 2 kittens and one was skinny and malnourished I have been feeding them PetLac formula for about a month now and they absolutely love it and are very healthy and happy kittens. I just purchased another can of PetLac for them I’m a very satisfied customer 😊👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻😊👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻😊
customer_reviews.author: Levodis

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I got a 6 week old kitten and gave him this milk with some canned cat food mixed in. He would lick the plate clean. It served several purposes as to providing water, milk and the canned food. It does lump up but I use warm water and mix it with a fork. My kitten is now 14 weeks old but will only eat the powdered milk mixed with can food.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Parker

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Petlack!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 sick cats and I was so worried because they are not eating and drinking water. I check online and read all the good reviews on this milk product. I force feed my 2 kitty cats and after 3 days of patiently feeding them 2 to 3 times a day using a medicine dropper, they started to eat on their own. Thanks to Petlack milk powder, if I did not give Petlack to my kitty cats they will be dead by now.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Paz Jose-Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great formula!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome formula! Came in handy for saving a kitten's life when her momma abandoned her. That was 1 year ago, and I've rescued another kitten at the same time of year this year. This little guy LOVES this formula! This stuff is really great. I had to buy some other formula at the vets for a lot more money while I was waiting for this one to get here, and it made him very sick. There's NO coming back up with this stuff! They love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Good formula at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Very good price. Mixed very well. We run a rescue & this yr we have had a lot of bottle babies. 1 kitten refused to nurse on the can kitten formula but he sucked this one down. Powder formula can constipated so we added some mineral oil, probiotics & a tad bit more water. He survived even though he was extremely underweight at 5 days old. Other kittens did well too.
customer_reviews.author: A Tail To Remember Animal Sanctuary

customer_reviews.title: Not just for kittens!
customer_reviews.text: Only used for 2 days, the ill cat was force fed with a syringe and this perked her appetite back into gear after going off her food for over a 2wks(drank plenty of water though). She was already obese so the anorexia wasn't horrible to her body condition during her bout of pyometra. (She's getting spayed) Antibiotics, this stuff and some TLC, her open pyo is gone and shes back to eating and playing.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and price!
customer_reviews.text: I foster newborn kittens for my local shelter. I love the quality of this product and Amazon had THE BEST PRICE on it and believe me, I looked everywhere! I now purchase regularly and have it shipped straight to the shelter. Thanks, Amazon, for making a quality product so affordable and easy to get to the shelter and start these kitties off with a healthy life!!
customer_reviews.author: C Evans

customer_reviews.title: Saved our baby's life 💕
customer_reviews.text: Me and my husband rescued a very tiny kitten about two years ago. She couldn't have been any older than 2 or 3 weeks old, so she really should not have been away from her mother yet. She was abandoned and would not have made it. Regular cow milk would not have been a good choice as it would have dehydrated her even more. We got a kitten bottle and this formula and two years later, she is healthy and happy. We are thankful every single day!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Meyer

customer_reviews.title: A real Life Saver!
customer_reviews.text: Two kittens abandoned by mother are thriving after several weeks of this replacement milk. Tip- buy multiple canisters as it goes very quickly feeding them 3x a day.
customer_reviews.author: ImABeliever

customer_reviews.title: Kittens and mama both loved this milk formula
customer_reviews.text: Kittens and mama both loved this milk formula. The rescue group I foster with recommended this brand as it doesn't cause diarrhea like some others. It was easy to mix up—I recommend putting the powder and water in a jar with a good lid, and shaking vigorously. Sometimes you need to insert a knife or spoon to loosen the powder from the corners of the jar, but otherwise, shaking is the easiest and fastest way to mix. Store the powder in the refrigerator between uses. Be sure to use up mixed formula within 24 hours or dump it out and make fresh.
customer_reviews.author: ncstorace

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: This gave my kittens diarrhea and several other kittens at the humane society in my town. Be careful what you order - I now spend more money on KMR for the sake of my babies
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Stuedle

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: I fostered three one week old kittens till they were eight weeks old. I visited stores in my town and this exact product was three times the price. I bought one in store and ordered the rest from amazon. The products were exactly the same and the kittens are thriving! So thankful for this product!
customer_reviews.author: Khrysteena

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this for an 8 week old kitten who ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for an 8 week old kitten who refuses to eat anything but from his mother. He is sick and is getting skinnier. Purchased this in hopes of it helping him get over this hump he is on. I hope he gets through this sickness. Hes already been to the vets and been on antibiotics. :(
customer_reviews.author: andrew teboe

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 kittens and their momma. I have no idea what this tastes like but man do they love it! I bottle fed the kittens since mom was rejecting them at times, and they were obsessed with this milk. Momma cat also loved it and it’s great for nursing moms! Highly recommend. Good price and you get a lot of formula out the small can.
customer_reviews.author: Roxana

customer_reviews.title: I thought this was going to be a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: Ended up being HORRIBLE. My kitten died after using this product. (Who was perfectly healthy before.) He got weak and starting vomiting. I learned that this same company used to have problems giving kittens copper poisioning!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kittens milk didn’t get here!!
customer_reviews.text: I was due to get my kitten milk today- now I won’t gst it for another 3-5 days - so I’ll havd to spend 25.00 instead of 9.00 for the same milk. It only lasts 5 days with my foster kittens. I’m so dissapointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer. Renée/Don

customer_reviews.title: Great supplement.
customer_reviews.text: Supplement for kittens when Momma stopped nursing them Made up warm & placed in saucers. Drank it easily & continued to thrive.
customer_reviews.author: grandma

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving the kitten formula powder I noticed it wasn’t sealed probably. Once opened completely it was only half full. Completely disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: I fed the formula to my baby who came to us at one month of age. Even our 7-month-old baby slurps the leftover formula up. Little stuff is 10 weeks old now and still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia S. Herrrmann

customer_reviews.title: Use hot water not warm water when making then cool down in the fridge after
customer_reviews.text: Both of my kittens 4 weeks and 12 weeks old love this kitten formula but I would recommend using really hot water when making the milk instead of warm water like it says so the powder can dissolve quicker. After you mix the powder and water keep stirring with a spoon until it’s almost completely dissolved and then put it in the fridge to cool down.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Kirsch

customer_reviews.title: Kitten loves
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a rescue kitten we adopted. We were told the kitten was of the age 8 weeks and ready to leave the mom.. however after one night of the kitten crying we realized he was way to young. Purchased for him to have a long with his kitten chow. He is loving every drop.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Clark Guerra

customer_reviews.title: Best kitten formula
customer_reviews.text: I have been fostering bottle fed kittens for year and this is the only formula I will use. Easy to mix, keeps well for up to three months in a freezer. Kittens seem to like the taste as I have not had a problem getting them to eat. I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Wyogal1890

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay but not great
customer_reviews.text: I think my 6 weeks old kitten likes it.She still drink milk from the bowel & I also use miracle nipple Sometimes.Milk was dissolving okay for the 1st few days, more warmer the water it mixes better .After a week of use now I feel some grainy or sandy texture of the milk when mixed with water, which I didn’t like, better visible in the picture I shared.That coarser sandy stuff clog the miracle nipple so I had difficulty feeding.
customer_reviews.author: Mehmood

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great but causes constipation.
customer_reviews.text: We found a 3 day old kitten. She has done well with bottle feeding and loves the milk, but she struggles with constipation on a regular basis. Going to the bathroom is very painful for her. Can't wait to get her weened and pooping on her own comfortably and regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndley Warren

customer_reviews.title: Kittens love it. Growing big!
customer_reviews.text: My foster kittens love it! They didn’t take to bottle feeding so I fix it in a bowl for them. For 3 4-5 week olds I do 1 cup of water and 3 scoops of milk replacement and whisk it until there are no powder chunks. We do this 2 times a day along with solid food
customer_reviews.author: shopoholic

customer_reviews.title: Won't dissolve
customer_reviews.text: We could never get the milk too break down totally to come through the nipple on the bottle. We were thinking the babies were getting food but they won't. We were using the correct temperature water and we were shaking it in a glass container. So I would not recommend this milk.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Allen

customer_reviews.title: My cats didn’t like it
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper than KMR, mix and yield the same amount, but my cats barely touch it whereas they clean their plate when I brought KMR and meowing for more. However, the feral cats I had been feeding will drink it. But I think I’ll stick with KMR
customer_reviews.author: Susana

customer_reviews.title: PETLAC MILK
customer_reviews.text: THE PRODUCT WAS LIFESAVER LITTERALLY AND FIGURATIVE. I DID NOT TASTE IT BUT THE KITTEN SEEM TO LOVE IT. IT NURSED TO A HEALTHY KITTEN WHEN THE MOTHER LEFT HER. IT WAS EASY TO MIX MUCH LUNCH LIKE BABY FORMULA. IT WAS ENOUGH IN THE CAN TO LAST UNTIL SHE WAS ABLE DRINK REGULAR MILK. A+
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pet Formula
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver. We had a 2-week old kitten whom needed bottle fed so we ordered a can of formula. Then a week later we were given a 3-wk old baby racoon to rehabilitate. Both babies loved the formula and they are both fat and sassy now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: New kitten?  Use this
customer_reviews.text: For the first month you have them, use this milk. It will give them a beautiful coat, and they love love love it.
customer_reviews.author: footloose 321

customer_reviews.title: Saved my kitty
customer_reviews.text: Someone left an approximately 1 week old kitten near our trash can and this milk saved her life. I noticed it made her a little constipated from time to time but she loved it. Easy to use and very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: I. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: The kittens love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for a liter of kittens that a stray had not too long ago. The kittens seemed to have latched onto this stuff pretty quick. It's super cheap for replacement milk and it got to me quick so, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Ciandra K Bills

customer_reviews.title: My kitten loves it
customer_reviews.text: My kitten cries for this milk every morning. Specifically THIS brand. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest place to get this good formula
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t clump, mixed with hot water well. Kittens love it.. a Mix of half formula (made according to directions of container), half goat milk ( this limits the unhealthy ingredients in all power formulas and lessens the cost too.) and its perfect. Twice the price at petco.. Was $20! Here its $9-10?
customer_reviews.author: PRESCILA WILKINS

customer_reviews.title: Great supplement for kitten
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product for a great price. I am fostering a kitten that was very sick 2 weeks ago. I forced fed this for about 10 days until she was ready to eat on her own. The kitten is doing amazing and I am so thankful for this product,
customer_reviews.author: SALI D FEHER

customer_reviews.title: Kitten loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 week old picky eater, skinny kitten loves this milk. I’m using it as a supplement with his dry food until he gains some weight. It mixes well with no clumping. Smells good.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Food for abandoned kitten
customer_reviews.text: Important food for an abandoned kitten. Kitten no longer requires this food since he is now 15 weeks old and very healthy. (He was only two weeks-old when he was abandoned by his young mother.)
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: 'Crat' Addict!
customer_reviews.text: My cat acts like a crack addict when we bring out the bottle. She is a senior cat - we bought this to sooth her tummy and provide some cuddle opportunities for her with. We do dilute it a bit so she doesn't get too many extra calories - but I have never seen her so focused on any food before this - she loves to eat, don't get me wrong, but nothing has ever excited her as much as this formula. And it does seem to calm her anxious tummy some.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Great formula
customer_reviews.text: I used this formula to feed a kitten who was abandoned by its mother. It mixes well. I used a blender bottle to mix it. The kitten loves this formula and it seems to digest it well with less constipation issues than the brand found at our local Walmart store. My kitten is growing well and has lots of energy thanks to this great formula!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great milk replacer
customer_reviews.text: I took in an abandoned kitten that needed bottle fed. The kitten prefers the powdered milk over the liquid formula. The little one has gained weight and is doing great.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: For the kitties
customer_reviews.text: I personally didn't use it. But I do donate it to a no-kill shelter for their kittens..."kitten season" seems to last most of the year. I know it is truly appreciated...they don't forget to tell me so much it helps!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Carey

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This was the least expensive kitten milk replacer I could find and the kittens did very well on it. They found it very palatable and gained weight well on it without stomach upset.
customer_reviews.author: B roy

customer_reviews.title: Will use again, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Best replacement kitten formula for bottle-feeding newborn kittens abandon/separated from their mother. Very easy on their digestive system with no diarrhea side-effects like it's sister formula KMR caused, although they are both by the same manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Just saying....

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my cat that had kittens. Fortunately we did not need to use for the kittens but used it for MAMA to have extra calories and for one of my other cats that needed to gain weight. They both loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Miroballi

customer_reviews.title: Worked good to wean kittens
customer_reviews.text: Idk why they ask to rate the flavor, I didn’t drink this haha. Some kittens loved it, some didn’t care for it. It got the job done
customer_reviews.author: shyann

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Baby Kittens
customer_reviews.text: I will be adopting 2 kitties in the very near future. Since I'm not sure what their ages will be, I purchased a few of this product in order to be prepared. I believe I will be satisfied with what kitties will need if they're not at stage of eating wet food.
customer_reviews.author: Payne

customer_reviews.title: The product is fine, but I must admit
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine, but I must admit, once it's mixed, it doesn't smell that appealing. My kitten doesn't like it as much as the KMR milk. But he will drink it if he has no other option. I'd prefer he liked it, like with the KMR. I'm usually pouring out as much as I mix because he never finishes it before it starts to curdle.
customer_reviews.author: TheGirlFromBama

customer_reviews.title: They loved it and all grew healthy and strong
customer_reviews.text: I rescued some baby kittens and immediately ordered this. They loved it and all grew healthy and strong. You have to mix it with hot water or it will be clumpy. Hot from the faucet, add the formula to a infant bottle and shake hard. By the time you pour it into a glass dish for them to drink its war,. Like Mama's milk.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Petlac kitten milk formula
customer_reviews.text: Have been weaning 4 kittens and they love the flavor. They have tons of energy and are growing fast. I believe that this is due to the quality of this formula.
customer_reviews.author: apinidaho

customer_reviews.title: Strange smell
customer_reviews.text: My kitten didn't like it at all, it doesn't even look and smell like real milk, more like a sweet protein shake. Maybe it's good for them, I don't know, I decided to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best products on the market. Good price. Fast shipping. I use this for rescued kittens and preemie kittens. Kittens will suckle this from a dropper. This can be used for other small animals as well. This along with goats milk (available at many grocery stores now) is truly a little life saver. I use 1 tablespoon goat milk, 1 tablespoon water, one half tablespoon powder, but mix as directed by your vet.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: Preferred for foster kittens.
customer_reviews.text: This brand is my go to for my fosters that are older than 2 weeks. No diarrhea or constipation from it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent kittens milk
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent kittens milk, I had two orphan kittens at my door, and had to order this product overnight, the kittens are healthy and they loved this milk. I'm very thankful for the overnight shipping, which was at no extra charge.
customer_reviews.author: Ed f.

customer_reviews.title: Caused diarrhea and kittens died!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my kittens because Mom doesn't have milk yet, sad to say they had really bad diarrhea and died! Stay away from this!
customer_reviews.author: Fritzy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fostering kittens!
customer_reviews.text: We foster lots of kittens and have ordered many cans of this. It’s easy to work with, doesn’t upset the tummies of kittens, and is the best price we’ve found. We’ll continue to order 3 cans at a time!!! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Hea

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: The milk you buy at other stores (other brands) gets sticky as soon as you open it. This stays powdery the whole time it’s open.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This formula is really great, the kitten I was nursing loved it. It smelled sweet (like kitten formula is supposed to), mixed well, and the cost was about half the cost of the bigger named formula that I picked up at tractor supply in a hurry. That more expensive formula smelled gross, stayed chunky when mixing, the kitten didn't get excited about it and was way overpriced. PetLac is a great choice if you have a kitten to nurse. Just remember to keep the dry formula stored in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Waugh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacer.
customer_reviews.text: The momma cat died when her 3 babies was only 3 weeks old so I ordered this milk and they loved it and it helped them grow so fast and they r perfectly healthy and had no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda champion

customer_reviews.title: My foster kittens love it so much They're without mom but still growing ...
customer_reviews.text: My foster kittens love it so much They're without mom but still growing up and super healthy good milk ever
customer_reviews.author: Trang Lawler

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is the worst and I wouldn't feed it to anything you want ...
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it zero...stars I would. It killed all five of my babies. I had them on another milk supplement and I switched to this because I could get it delivered in the mail. This stuff is the worst and I wouldn't feed it to anything you want to keep alive!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Sticky
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to make. Seems like the kittens like it. Only downside is that it’s sticky if it spills.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Kitten likes it!
customer_reviews.text: The kitten I'm caring for is drinking it like it's the yummiest thing he's ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Nanita Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It asks me to review the flavor? Sorry I didn’t try it lol but I’ll ask my kitten about it later.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for orphaned kittens!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff was a lifesaver for feeding my 4 week old kittens who's Mama left. They did great on it and I gave it to them for a week and a half then slowly weaned them off and now they are doing just great! Honestly I don't know what I would have done without this stuff!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Neumann

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats
customer_reviews.text: My kitten loves this but did you know it also makes an excellent insect catching container when it’s empty ?
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Good value, happy kittens
customer_reviews.text: So much cheaper than the 5$ cans of KMR. I used slightly warm water and the powder disolved easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kitten loves it
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time my kitten loves the stuff and takes it readily. He's getting big and healthy.
customer_reviews.author: JA Steel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap due to 1/2 missing
customer_reviews.text: Very dissatisfied ... when I opened the product... it was only 1/2 full
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Contains soy
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to find that this contains soy which may not be the best protein for cats.
customer_reviews.author: bargain hunter

customer_reviews.title: My kitten lives it
customer_reviews.text: My kitten lives it. I like the powder. I can water it down easily for transitioning to water.
customer_reviews.author: NovaKat

customer_reviews.title: Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I used for a rescued kitten. He seemed to like it. I gave it 4 stars because it didn’t always mix well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: but it has probiotics that is good for their sensitive tummys
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product as we foster kittens. It is a bit pricier than the other milk replacements out there, but it has probiotics that is good for their sensitive tummys.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Barry

customer_reviews.title: A rescue must have!
customer_reviews.text: My rescue uses this product when we have underweight, underage, or malnourished kittens and it works like a charm every time! Couldn't do it without KMR
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Great quality kitten formula!
customer_reviews.text: This will suit me quite nicely for my foster bottle kitties!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: They are now 9 weeks and doing great.
customer_reviews.text: My kittens did very well on PetLac. They were bottle fed for 4 weeks. I was given the kittens when they were at least 2 weeks of age. They are now 9 weeks and doing great.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl  O

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our little kitty loved it. Helped to bulk him up and fill his tummy between canned food feedings.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine A Jones

customer_reviews.title: Omg
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves it and i will definitely buy more
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Petlac Milk Powder For Kittens, 10.5-Ounce
feature_bullets: Petlac Kitten Milk Replacement Powder. Animal Health Supplies
